Class Bar

java.lang.Object
greenfoot.Actor
Bar
public class Bar extends greenfoot.Actor
Class Bar: for use as a health bar or progress bar as well as for other types of measurements for visual of value in a bar form DO NOT EDIT THIS CLASS as everything can be controlled through method calls.
Version:
(2012/2/5)
Author:
danpost (https://www.greenfoot.org/users/2991)

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Bar(String refText, String unitType, int initValue, int maxValue)
    Bar Constructor: saves the initial values that are brought in and creates the bar image through the 'add(int)' call, which sets the initial value of the bar and calls the 'newImage' method to build and set a new image for the bar.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    add(int amount)
    Method 'add': add an amount to the value of the bar, checks to make sure the new value is between minimumValue and maximumValue, then, calls 'newImage' to build and set the new image for the bar.
    greenfoot.Color
    getBackgroundColor()
    Method 'getBackgroundColor': returns the current background color of the image for the bar
    int
    getBarHeight()
    Method 'getBarHeight': returns the current height of the bar (color portion only)
    int
    getBarWidth()
    Method 'getBarWidth': returns the current width of the bar (color portion only)
    boolean
    getBreakLow()
    Method 'getBreakLow': returns the boolean value that determines if the danger color is used at the low end or the high end of the range (setting it to 'minimumValue' or 'maximumValue' will essentially deactivate breaking)
    int
    getBreakPercent()
    Method 'getBreakPercent': returns the range percent at which the color of the bar changes between lower values and higher values (the variable 'usingBreakValue' must be 'false' for percent breaking is to be active; using 'setBreakPercent' will automatically set 'usingBreakValue' to 'false'.
    int
    getBreakValue()
    Method 'getBreakValue': returns the current value at which the color of the bar will change (the variable 'usingBreakValue' must be 'true' for value breaking is to be active; using 'setBreakValue' will automatically set 'usingBreakVaule' to 'true'.
    greenfoot.Color
    getDangerColor()
    Method 'getDangerColor': returns the current color used for values below any break point, if 'breakLow' is 'true' else above
    float
    getFontSize()
    Method 'getFontSize': returns the current font size for the text used in the bar image
    int
    getMaximumValue()
    Method 'getMaximumValue': returns the current maximum value of the bar
    int
    getMinimumValue()
    Method 'getMinimumValue': returns the current minimum value of the bar
    String
    getReferenceText()
    Method 'getReferenceText': returns the string set as the title text of the bar
    greenfoot.Color
    getSafeColor()
    Method 'getSafeColor': returns the current color used for values above any break point, if 'breakLow' is 'true', else below
    boolean
    getShowTextualUnits()
    Method 'getShowTextualUnits': returns the current state of showing/hiding of the textual value and unit of measure of the bar
    greenfoot.Color
    getTextColor()
    Method 'getTextColor': returns the current text and frame color
    String
    getUnitOfMeasure()
    Method 'getUnitOfMeasure': returns the current string used to qualify the value of the bar
    int
    getValue()
    Method 'getValue': returns the current value of the bar
    void
    setBackgroundColor(greenfoot.Color color)
    Method 'setBackgroundColor': sets a new color to use behind the text and bar of the image
    void
    setBarHeight(int height)
    Method 'setBarHeight': sets a new height for the color portion of the bar
    void
    setBarWidth(int width)
    Method 'setBarWidth': sets a new width for the color portion of the bar
    void
    setBreakLow(boolean lowBreak)
    Method setBreakLow: sets the direction of safe to danger values; true: danger values are low and safe values are high; false: danger values are high ...
    void
    setBreakPercent(int percent)
    Method 'setBreakPercent': sets a new percentage value where the bar changes colors between safe and danger values (if set to zero or one hundred, the bar will stay a constant color) 'usingBreakValue' will be automatically set to 'false' when this method is called
    void
    setBreakValue(int brkVal)
    Method 'setBreakValue': sets a new value for where the color of the color portion of the bar will change between safe and danger values (if set to minimumValue or maximumValue, the bar will stay a constant color) 'usingBreakValue' will be automatically set to 'true' when this method is called
    void
    setDangerColor(greenfoot.Color color)
    Method 'setDangerColor': sets a new color for the color portion of the bar for danger values
    void
    setFontSize(float size)
    Method 'setFontSize': sets the font size to use for all text in the bar image
    void
    setMaximumValue(int maxVal)
    Method 'setMaximumValue': sets a new maximum for allowable values for the bar
    void
    setMinimumValue(int minVal)
    Method 'setMinimumValue': sets a new minimum for allowable values for the bar
    void
    setReferenceText(String refText)
    Method 'setReferenceText': sets new title text for the bar
    void
    setSafeColor(greenfoot.Color color)
    Method 'setSafeColor': sets a new color for the color portion of the bar for safe values
    void
    setShowTextualUnits(boolean show)
    Method 'setShowTextualUnits': sets the state of showing/hiding of the textual value and unit of measure on the right side of the bar
    void
    setTextColor(greenfoot.Color color)
    Method 'setTextColor': sets a new color for the text and frame of the bar image
    void
    setUnitOfMeasure(String uom)
    Method 'setUnitOfMeasure': sets new unit of measure text for the bar
    void
    setValue(int val)
    Method 'setValue': sets a new value for the bar, if in bounds
    void
    subtract(int amount)
    Method 'subtract': subtracts an amount from the value of the bar, checks to make sure the new value does not overstep its bounds, then, calls 'newImage' to build and set the new image for the bar.

    Methods inherited from class greenfoot.Actor

    act, addedToWorld, getImage, getIntersectingObjects, getNeighbours, getObjectsAtOffset, getObjectsInRange, getOneIntersectingObject, getOneObjectAtOffset, getRotation, getWorld, getWorldOfType, getX, getY, intersects, isAtEdge, isTouching, move, removeTouching, setImage, setImage, setLocation, setRotation, sleepFor, turn, turnTowards

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • add

      public void add(int amount)
      Method 'add': add an amount to the value of the bar, checks to make sure the new value is between minimumValue and maximumValue, then, calls 'newImage' to build and set the new image for the bar.

    • subtract

      public void subtract(int amount)
      Method 'subtract': subtracts an amount from the value of the bar, checks to make sure the new value does not overstep its bounds, then, calls 'newImage' to build and set the new image for the bar.

      public int getBreakValue()
      Method 'getBreakValue': returns the current value at which the color of the bar will change (the variable 'usingBreakValue' must be 'true' for value breaking is to be active; using 'setBreakValue' will automatically set 'usingBreakVaule' to 'true'.
